page.title: 10Local History Sampford
page.content: Originally Sandy ford,Sampford gained Courtney after the family who were Lords of the Manor in the Middle Ages until 1535.In 1570 Kings College, Cambridge took over and were Lords of the Manor until 1920 when it was sold. The original Estate included Exbourne, Honeychurch and down to Sticklepath.It was a large holding in Domesday, assessed at 1 hide,4 ploughs worked by 8 slaves.A few of the Domesday farms still exist and many more date from the 1500s. Sampford is famous as the scene of a massacre in{JUNE 1549.}The local populace objected to the new English Prayer Book. One man,William Hellyons was murdered on the steps of the Court House,where his ghost has been seen lying.The revolt ended in a massacre of over 600 people.
